sect1.title: Scale Tool
sect1.para: The Scale Tool is used to rotate images or layers.

listitem.para: The available tool options for the Scale Tool can be accessed by double clicking the Scale Tool icon.
The Transform Direction sets which way a layer is scaled. The Traditional mode will scale the layer from the bottom right corner.
Corrective Rotation will scale the layer from the top left corner.
The Interpolation drop-down list allows you to choose the quality of the transformation. For more information about the different methods that can be employed, see the glossary entry Interpolation.
This option will clip the scaled layer to the original layer size.
The two available grid options are used to change the visual display of the scaled grid.
Don't Show Grid will display only the outline of the scaled layer.
Number of Grid Lines will allow control over the total number of displayed grid lines. Use the Density slider to set the number of grid lines.
Density allows control over the distance between the grid lines. Use the Density slider to set the distance.
Keep Height will constrain the scale such that the height of the layer will remain constant.
Keep Width will constrain the scale such that the width of the layer will remain constant.

The
Shift t
key combo will change the active tool to Scale.
Holding Ctrl will constrain the scale height.
Holding Alt will constrain the scale width.
